titleStmt.title: A. C. Hamilten et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6850

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his excelency Thomas E Bramlett govenor of Kentucky we the uder Signed pray your excelency to remit a fine imposed on John W Scott for an aledged breach of the peace comitted on the pe^r^son of Joseph Smart at the poles in the town of Carlile in Nicholas County ^on the 7 august^ we being citizens of Nicholas County pray your excelency to remit the same and by so dooing you will confer a faver ^on^ the Loyal people of ^this^ County

A C Hamilten
A, W, Blair S, N, C
Jesse.. W.. Troutman
Andrew.O. Everman
Joseph T. Booth
granvill Snapp
daniel Snapp
W,, H, Fuller
Jetson Levin
J R McCullough
Ben F West
T. H. Shannon
Isaac N West
A Z Blunt
John.C. Hazelrigg
Pressley Kendall
William H Carr
George H. Troutman
Ransom Kendall
Sanford Kendall
George h darty
Daniel Everman
Calib masterson
John Suddurth
M B Smedley
Jacob Sky
W W Tuttle

Nicholas Qr Ct
vs
J W Scott
$25,
Breach Peace
Remitted 13th Dec/65
